attributes.text:
The Core module’s responsibility is to query the DOM for elements and offer these elements as a collection. The Core module itself does not offer any methods to work with the collection. These methods are added by the other included modules, such as Manipulating or Attributes.

Core also provides the plugin API which allows modules to attach either static functions to the global q object or define methods on the collection it returns.

By default, the core module is assigned to a global module named q. In case q is already defined, the name qxWeb is used instead.

For further details, take a look at the documentation in the user manual.
A map containing the methods to attach.
This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q}.
This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new initialization methods to {@link q} which will be called when a new collection is created.
A map containing the methods to attach.
This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q}.
An array of Elements which will be initialized as {@link q}. All items in the array which are not either a window object or a node object will be ignored.
Name of the class. If null, the class will not be attached to a namespace.
Define a new class using the qooxdoo class system.
Unregisters a normalization function from the given event types.
Executes the given function once the document is ready.
Hook function to be called on event registration
Hook function to be called on event deregistration
Registers an event hook for the given event types.
List of event types to be normalized. Use an asterisk (*) to normalize all event types

Registers a normalization function for the given event types. Listener callbacks for these types will be called with the return value of the normalization function instead of the regular event object.

The normalizer will be called with two arguments: The original event object and the element on which the event was triggered
Hook function to be called on event registration
Hook function to be called on event deregistration
Unregisters a hook from the given event types.
Valid selector (CSS3 + extensions) or DOM element or Array of DOM Elements.
Only the children of this element are considered.

Accepts a selector string and returns a set of found items. The optional context element can be used to reduce the amount of found elements to children of the context element.

Sizzle is used as selector engine. Check out the documentation for more details.
As many items as you want to add.
Returns a copy of the collection including the given elements.
Gets a new collection containing only those elements that passed the given filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function.
New collection containing the elements that passed the filter
Returns a new collection containing the modified elements. For more details, check out the MDN documentation.
New collection containing the elements that passed the filter
Returns a copy of the collection within the given range.
A new collection containing a slice of the original collection.
As many items as you want to add.
Removes the given number of items and returns the removed items as a new collection. This method can also add items. Take a look at the documentation of MDN for more details.
A new collection containing the removed items.
Returns the class name of the first element in the collection

Shows any elements with “display: none” in the collection. If an element was hidden by using the {@link #hide} method, its previous “display” style value will be re-applied. Otherwise, the default “display” value for the element type will be applied.
Replaces a class name on each element in the collection
Checks if one or more listeners for the given event type are attached to the first element in the collection
true if one or more listeners are attached
Name of the style property to modify
Modifies the given style property on all elements in the collection.
Returns the rendered width of the first element in the collection
The duration in milliseconds of the animation, which will override the duration given in the description.

Starts the animation with the given description. The description should be a map, which could look like this:

{
  "duration": 1000,
  "keep": 100,
  "keyFrames": {
    0 : {"opacity": 1, "scale": 1},
    100 : {"opacity": 0, "scale": 0}
  },
  "origin": "50% 50%",
  "repeat": 1,
  "timing": "ease-out",
  "alternate": false,
  "delay": 2000
}

duration is the time in milliseconds one animation cycle should take.

keep is the key frame to apply at the end of the animation. (optional)

keyFrames is a map of separate frames. Each frame is defined by a number which is the percentage value of time in the animation. The value is a map itself which holds css properties or transforms (Transforms only for CSS Animations).

origin maps to the transform origin {@link qx.bom.element.Transform#setOrigin} (Only for CSS animations).

repeat is the amount of time the animation should be run in sequence. You can also use “infinite”.

timing takes one of these predefined values: ease | linear | ease-in | ease-out | ease-in-out | cubic-bezier(<number>, <number>, <number>, <number>) (cubic-bezier only available for CSS animations)

alternate defines if every other animation should be run in reverse order.

delay is the time in milliseconds the animation should wait before start.
Manipulates the play state of the animation. This can be used to pause an animation when running.
Hides all elements in the collection by setting their “display” style to “none”. The previous value is stored so it can be re-applied when {@link #show} is called.
Returns the content height of the first element in the collection. This is the maximum height the element can use, excluding borders, margins, padding or scroll bars.
Returns the values of multiple style properties for each item in the collection
Returns the rendered height of the first element in the collection.
A map of style property name/value pairs
Sets multiple style properties for each item in the collection.
Fades in all elements in the collection.
Toggles the given class name on each item in the collection
Adds a class name to each element in the collection
Manipulates the play state of the animation. This can be used to continue an animation when paused.
Fades out all elements in the collection.
Removes a class name from each element in the collection
Toggles the given list of class names on each item in the collection
Removes multiple class names from each element in the collection
Returns the value of the given style property for the first item in the collection.
Unregisters event listeners for the given type from each element in the collection.
Returns whether an animation is running or not.
Returns the distance between the first element in the collection and its offset parent
a map with the keys left and top containing the distance between the elements
The duration in milliseconds of the animation, which will override the duration given in the description.
Starts an animation in reversed order. For further details, take a look at the {@link #animate} method.
Type of the event to listen for
Context the callback function will be executed in. Default: The element on which the listener was registered
Registers a listener for the given event type on each item in the collection. This can be either native or custom events.
Returns the computed location of the given element in the context of the document dimensions.
A map with the keys left>, top>, right> and bottom> which contains the distance of the element relative to the document.
Checks if the first element in the collection has the given class name
true if the first item has the given class name
Adds multiple class names to each element in the collection
Returns whether an animation has ended or not.
Optional data that will be passed to the listener callback function.
Fire an event of the given type.
Returns the content width of the first element in the collection. This is the maximum width the element can use, excluding borders, margins, padding or scroll bars.
Type of the event to listen for
Context the callback function will be executed in. Default: The element on which the listener was registered
Attaches a listener for the given event that will be executed only once.
